title: The Last Prophet of Nothing
premise: A young woman is violently anointed as the world's prophesied savior, only to discover the celestial 'gods' she is meant to serve are cosmic parasites, and her true destiny is not to fulfill the prophecy, but to starve them by extinguishing all magic forever. To save humanity, she must become the ultimate villain, systematically dismantling the very source of her own power and making enemies of every kingdom, mage, and divine being that depends on it. Her only allies are a heretical cult that believes salvation lies in a silent, mundane world—a fate many would consider worse than death.
protagonist: Elara, a reluctant conduit of immense magical power who feels the agonizing 'hunger' of the gods every time she uses it.
conflict: Elara's internal and external battle to unravel a millennia-old lie and commit a universal act of targeted genocide against the parasitic deities, while being hunted as the chosen savior by those who don't know the truth and as the greatest heretic by those who do.
setting: The once-vibrant, magic-suffused realm of Aethyr, now a decaying gothic landscape where the sky bleeds light and grand cities are built upon ossified leylines that pulse like diseased veins.
tone: Philosophically bleak, visceral, and morally ambiguous, with moments of profound loss punctuating a relentless, desperate crusade.
